subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 25, 2007

TOP STORIESAl-Sadr Reappears In Iraq At Rally
Firebrand, anti-American cleric Muqtada al-Sadr has appeared in public for the first time in months, leading a huge rally
                        in one of Iraq's holiest Shiite cities. He's thought to be jockeying for political power in hopes of a U.S. troop reduction. More...Watch: One Missing Soldier Found Dead
• Congress OKs War Funding, Minus Timeline• N. Korea Tests Short-Range Missiles• Minimum Wage Hike ApprovedU.S.New Tests Question JFK Lone Gunman Theory
New testing on the type of ammunition used in the 1963 assassination of President John F. Kennedy raises questions about whether
                        Lee Harvey Oswald acted alone, according to a study by researchers at Texas A&M University. More...
• Bizarre Execution In Ohio• FBI Releases Photos Of Deadly Bank Heist• Chandra Levy's Mother Wants Case Solved• More StoriesWorldU.S. Military Aid Reaches Lebanese Army
U.S. military aid has been rushed into Lebanon, to help the army in its fight against an Islamic militant group holed up in
                        a Palestinian refugee camp. Sporadic gunfire is still taking place near the camp's entrance, keeping the situation tense.
                         More...Watch: Lebanon Cease-Fire Collapses
• Al-Sadr Reappears In Iraq At Rally
                     					| Watch• N. Korea Tests Short-Range Missiles• Is Europe's Air Security Tight Enough?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsCongress OKs War Funding, Minus Timeline
"We're going to have to fund them," said Sen. Joseph Biden, as he and other Democrats in Congress reluctantly approved billions
                        to pay for the Iraq war, minus the troop withdrawal timeline that was previously met by a veto from President Bush. More...
• CBS Poll: Clinton, Giuliani Still In Front• Minimum Wage Hike Approved• Fred Thompson Fuels Speculation In Ct.• More StoriesHealthWhen Health Coverage Doesn't Hold Up
Continuing the CBS News Investigates series on questionable practices by health insurance providers to individuals,
                        Armen Keteyian reports that for people with coverage, filing a simple, single claim can cost them big. More...Watch: Collecting On Insurance Claims
• Tooth Whiteners: Something For Everyone• Pot During Pregnancy May Harm Fetal Brain• Study: Babies Understand Language Shifts• More StoriesSciTechBeing Here, Working There
Today's videoconferencing technology is allowing film makers across the globe to meet face to face and moms to commute daily
                        from Texas to California. John Blackstone has the story. More...Watch: Communicating On A New Level
• Find Your Way To Latest GPS Devices• Whale Rescuers Take A Break 
                     					| Watch• New Tests Question JFK Lone Gunman Theory• More StoriesBusinessMinimum Wage Hike Approved
America's lowest-paid workers won a $2.10 raise Thursday, with Congress approving the first increase in the federal minimum
                        wage since 1997. By summer 2009, all minimum wage jobs will pay no less than $7.25 an hour. More...
• Can Your Finances Survive A Hurricane?• Stations Boycott Their Own Gas Over Prices
                     					| Watch• New Home Sales Surge, But Prices Drop• More StoriesEntertainmentWill Rosie Leave "View" Early?
The bubbling political and personal tension between Rosie O'Donnell and Elizabeth Hasselbeck came to a head on "The View"
                        when the two resurrected their fight about O'Donnell's comments on the U.S. troops in Iraq and terrorists. More...
• Fans To Serenade Jim Nabors At Indy 500• Perez Hilton, Defender Of Bloggers Rights?• "CSI": The Museum Experience
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionBarry Bonds: Cheater
Dick Meyer won't be cheering when Barry Bonds breaks Hank Aaron's home run record this summer. The reason? Bonds, says
                        Meyer, is a cheater.  More...
• CBS Poll: Clinton, Giuliani Still In Front• No Smoking Gun From Goodling
                     					| Watch• A Mormon Mission... For Romney?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Find Your Way To Latest GPS Devices
CBS News Science and Technology correspondent Daniel Sieberg does, in The Early Show's new "Gadget
                        Lab." He explains what GPS is, tells the features to look for, and has specifics on many new offerings. More...

                                    friend. Jeff Glor has more.
